NYU Undergraduate Internships

Internship Overview

  • Please contact the Office of Global Services for details on F-1 internship eligibility.
  • Minimum GPA 2.50.
  • No outstanding incompletes!
  • No Fail grades on previous internships.
  • Spring and fall: minimum 12 weeks.
  • Summer: minimum 8 weeks.
  • Minimum hours: 240.
  • Start and end dates must fit within a semester.
  • Full-time students can't work more than 20 hours per week while classes are in session.
  • Student must have an appointed supervisor.
  • Students must have an official offer letter.
  • Students must update their placement information through their NYU CareerNet Account Profile.
  • Prospective employers must send the advisor a detailed job description.
  • Students will submit their offer letter, job description, and printed NYU CareerNet Profile to their departmental adviser.
  • For approved International Students, the faculty adviser will provide the Office of Global Scholars (OGS) with all relevant information.
  • The company supervisor must provide a mid-term evaluation and a final evaluation to the faculty supervisor.
  • The student will submit a project report at the end of the term.
  • All CP courses will be graded as Pass (P) or Fail (F).
  • Consecutive work experiences may be completed with the same employer.
